title: Access Array Data with Indexes
content: You can access the data inside arrays using indexes.

Array indexes are written in the same bracket notation that strings use, except that instead of specifying a character, they are specifying an entry in the array. Like strings, arrays are zero-based indexing, so the first element in an array has an index od 0.
The console.log(array[0]) prints 50 and data has the value 60.

exercises.instruction: Create a variable called myData and set it to equal the first value of myArray using bracket notation.

hint: The variable myData should equal the first value of myArray.
The data in variable myArray should be accessed using bracket notation.
